Class AudioSettingsController

  • java.lang.Object
    • AudioSettingsController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class AudioSettingsController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class handles the Audio Settings window where users can adjust volume levels of the game's audio. Version History - version 1.0 Filename: AudioSettingsController.java
    Since:
    25-04-2020 copyright: No Copyright Purpose
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sean Coaker

      AudioSettingsController() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double getFxScale()
      Gets the value of the sound effects volume.
      static double getMasterScale()
      Gets the value of the master volume.
      static double getMusicScale()
      Gets the value of the music volume.
      void initialize(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle rb)
      Sets up the window with the correct details before the user can see the window.
      void onButtonClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This class takes the user back to their running game or to the menu depending on where they clicked the audio settings button.
      static void readFile()
      This class reads volume levels from a file so that the user can keep their audio settings even if they close the game.
      static void setInGame(boolean inGame)
      This class is used to set if the user is in game or not.
      void writeToFile()
      This class writes new audio settings to a file used to store these settings.
